ai.summary: Green Link Walk (Section 3) is an approximately 8 km moderate hike in the UK, forming the middle portion of the longer Green Link Walk route. This section typically features a steady, mixed surface with gentle elevation changes and scenic glimpses of rural scenery, making it suitable for hikers with some experience and good footwear.
ai.terrain_summary: The route comprises a mix of well-marked gravel or compacted earth paths, grass verges, and occasional muddy stretches. Expect gentle ascents and descents, short sections with uneven ground or tree roots, and occasional views across open countryside. Footing is generally good, but conditions can be slippery after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast before setting out and be prepared for UK conditions. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and dress in layers. Carry enough water and some high-energy snacks. Stay on the marked path, bring a map or GPS, and know your route. Allow extra time in case of mud or delays, and avoid hiking alone after dark. If livestock or gates are encountered, close gates behind you and respect local rules. Inform someone of your plans and expected return.
recommended_gear: Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 L)
Small first aid kit and blister care
Lightweight rain cover or pack liner
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of delays)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) typically offers the best conditions for this section; winter can be muddier and daylight is shorter, requiring careful planning.

seo.title: Green Link Walk Section 3 – 8 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Green Link Walk Section 3, an 8 km moderate hike in the United Kingdom. Learn about terrain, safety tips, gear suggestions, and the best seasons for this route.
